main_definition: Displaying courage or willingness to face fear, pain, danger, etc., especially in difficult situations.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Willing to confront fear or difficulty without flinching
meanings_and_examples.example: The firefighter showed great bravery while rescuing the family from the burning building.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Displaying courage in facing difficult challenges or situations
meanings_and_examples.example: Even though he was scared, she faced her fears and confronted the bullies at school.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not afraid to take risks or face potential danger
meanings_and_examples.example: The soldier acted bravely by charging into battle against overwhelming odds.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Showing determination in the pursuit of one's goals despite obstacles and fears
meanings_and_examples.example: She was brave enough to start her own business, even though she had never done it before.
